head.title: Universities Choose Recipients for Journalism Fellowships

hedline.hl1: Universities Choose Recipients for Journalism Fellowships

abstract.p: Four universities name recipients of journalism fellowships for 2000-01 academic year; fellowships involve range of study options; schools are Columbia University, University of Michigan, Stanford University and Harvard University (M)

block.p: Four universities have named the recipients of journalism fellowships for the 2000-01 academic year. The fellowships involve a range of study options.
Columbia University
Thirteen journalists specializing in arts and culture have been selected for the National Arts Journalism Program at Columbia University's Graduate School of Journalism.
Four universities have named the recipients of journalism fellowships for the 2000-01 academic year. The fellowships involve a range of study options.
Columbia University
Thirteen journalists specializing in arts and culture have been selected for the National Arts Journalism Program at Columbia University's Graduate School of Journalism.
Senior fellows:

Joseph Horowitz, author, journalist and artistic consultant on classical music
